entry.question: Does it have a rechargeable battery inside?
entry.answer: All Echo's are corded, not battery powered.

entry.question: Can I use Alexa to make phone calls through my iPhone, or does it do it some other way?
entry.answer: Yes. Amazon has setup it's own VOIP system, which is what makes the calls. It's completely free to call anyone, you can just specify the phone number you want to call or say a name from your address book. It uses the called I'd of our cellphone so that people see the call is from you. A good comparison would be Skype calling.

entry.question: Can I request any song to play?
entry.answer:
Echo Music: WiFi and an Amazon Account is required. It does not have to be a Prime account. The Echo's will default to the free Amazon Music. In Alexa Setup, Skills listed that you can enable:
1. Amazon Music (free) default, auto enables 2. Prime Music (Prime Member) auto enables 3. Pandora (free, link your own account)) 4. TuneIn (free) 5. iHeart (free) 6. Amazon Music Unlimited (subscription) 7. Spotify (subscription) 8. Sirius XM (subscription)
None of the enabled music Skills are required. TuneIn and iHeart will allow you to specify radio stations when commanding Alexa, both real and fabricated. If you do nothing, you will still have Amazon Music for free.

entry.question: Can it play the music favorites I have in my iTunes account?
entry.answer: You can. There is a skill you can enable called “my media” in the Alexa app. It allows you to basically link your home media or iTunes account on your computer. Once that’s done, you just say, “Alexa open my media and play The Beatles” for instance. It works great for me and we have Apple Music so there’s a lot of music. Hope this helps.

entry.question: Need your phone number to help set up alexa?
entry.answer: You do not need a phone number to setup the Echo, but you do need a smart phone or tablet with cell service to setup the calling service with drop in.

entry.question: Is the only difference between echo and dot the speaker?
entry.answer: Yes, that the only difference.

entry.question: Do you have to have Amazon Prime?
entry.answer: There seems to be some confusion about this. The answer depends on what you want your echo to do. Most of its features don't require Amazon Prime at all. You just need a smartphone that can use the Alexa app, a wifi connection, and an Amazon account. Some features, however, do require Amazon Prime. These are things like Amazon Prime Music, which require Prime, but can be accessed through other means than the echo.

entry.question: What is a Zigbee hub?
entry.answer: Zigbee is a wireless protocol used by many smart home products. The Hub acts like a middle man, allowing your Zigbee smart home devices to talk to other devices like the Echo Plus. You can sort of think of it like a translator that allows devices to communicate across platforms.

entry.question: Does alexa listen in on my conversations since it's always connected to the web?
entry.answer: No, the listening circuit is on the Echo device. When the device detects the wake work "Alexa" it begins streaming your command to the Alexa Voice Service on the Amazon Cloud (web). It records your commands and Alexa's response and saves them on your Amazon account. This helps Alexa "learn" your speech characteristics. You can see (and play and delete) these recordings in the Alexa app. Not to worry. :)

entry.question: Will it work with 220v electricity?
entry.answer: Much like most electronics (cell phone, laptop, tablets, etc.), the included power supply is 110-240v and as long as you have the proper adapter for the plug in your country of choice, it is fine. I can confirm this as I just took my Alexa to the Philippines and did not need a transformer. I left her there with my son to use in his condo.

entry.question: Can be used internationally?
entry.answer: You can use it wherever you have wifi access. But only a few languages are supported atm.

entry.question: Does Alexa Echo require the regular use of a smartphone?
entry.answer: For the first time how do I set up my alexa.

entry.question: Whats the difference between this and the plus?
entry.answer: The primary functional differences are that that the Plus includes a Zigbee Hub and has a larger tweeter. Physically, the Plus is similar to the 1st Generation Echo in size, shape and overall look and doesn't have interchangeable outer shells.

entry.question: Can I use echo to type a book manuscript?
entry.answer: No

entry.question: Does Echo have FM radio?
entry.answer: Yes, you can stream both AM and FM radio stations.

entry.question: Can I buy it here and use it in a another country like Israel?
entry.answer: As long as you have wireless internet and you download the Alexa app on your portable device i.e. phone, tablet then you should be fine. My only concern would be how it connects to electric, as the device itself is not electric. I know outlets in Germany are much different than the U.S. so make sure you look that up and get what you need for converting to their outlets before you go.

entry.question: Does it stream Siriusxm?
entry.answer: Yes.

entry.question: When I am not home, can I send a message to the echo from my cellphone and have it tell my wife, "I'm calling you, go find your cell phone."?
entry.answer: Yes this has been very useful for that reason. You can also just call the device from your iPhone app and if wife says "Alexa answer" you can talk over the speaker..... and help her work out work out where she left her phone this time!!

entry.question: If I have alexa app from 1st generation echo do I need to download app again to set up 2nd generation?
entry.answer:
Are you referring to the phone app or to an Alexa "skill?" The phone app is simply the Alexa app and is the same no matter which Echo device(s) you own or what generation they are. As for the Alexa skills, once enabled they will work with any Echo device (though of course you'll need an Echo Show or Echo Spot to get full functionality from any skills that utilize a screen).
The great thing about Alexa skills is that they run on Amazon's cloud, not your actual Echo device. So as Amazon adds skills to Alexa they automatically become available to you, and as skills themselves get updated you will automatically be running the most up-to-date version.

entry.question: How do I install it?
entry.answer: You plug it in to the wall, download the Alexa app and through the app you connect it to your Wi-Fi. Pretty easy.

entry.question: I don't have have Wi-Fi?
entry.answer: If you have a modem you can add a decent WiFi router for about $17. Then you'll have WiFi. (Check the Tenda router if interested.)

entry.question: So, an echo still requires to pay $3.99 month to play amazon music unlimited?
entry.answer: I was not aware of that...will check it out...thanks.

entry.question: Can Alexa work with 220 volts?
entry.answer: The Echo only plugs into 110 V, the Eco Dot plugs into the computer/laptop USB

entry.question: My new 2nd generation Echo does not have voice recognition available through the app on my iPad, why?
entry.answer: Pretty sure the Voice Profile can only be set up on a smartphone.

entry.question: Can you simplify commands - example: "alexa, play wcco radio". versus "alexa, play 8.30 wcco am radio through InTune"?
entry.answer: Is there only one radio station in Waco? Probably not. I find that after giving Alexa a detailed command (wordy) for a while it seems to "learn" keywords and I can shorten the command significantly. So maybe after giving the longer command a few times you can say "Alexa, play MY Waco radio". Alexa does involve AI.

entry.question: Can the material skin of the new generation 2 Echo be removed? Is there the traditional black plastic cover beneath that?
entry.answer: Yes, you can remove the cover, which Amazon calls a "shell", for cleaning or to change it out for another one.

entry.question: I need to reset mine because it will not connect to wifi. there is no reset button and i’ve tried holding down the microphone and volume down button.
entry.answer: I disconnect the plug from my Echo devices when they lose wifi; doing that resets them. I forgot the proper way to reset but when I originally tried that, it didn't work. So, unplugging echo connection Cord (attached to echo) and then plugging back in is what works for me. Unplugging the electric connect from the outlet and then plugging back in might work too.

entry.question: will Echo control any smart TV?
entry.answer: Broadlink makes a device they call the Black Bean. It can be added as a skill to the Echo and will act as a smart remote. It emits 360deg IR, and can learn from most remotes. This will not work if you device uses an RF connection, but very few do, so should not be an issue.

entry.question: Is echo portable?
entry.answer: I have moved it from an upstairs room to down stairs. That is all.

entry.question: Can the echo pair with more than one pair of Bluetooth speakers?
entry.answer: That’s a good question and I’m going to give you a half answer. I’m pretty sure only one Bluetooth at a time, HOWEVER, you can join multiple echoes, dots, shows , etc to create a GROUP that plays the same thing simultaneously wherever they are on your home network. Understand one thing important!!: if you have a Bluetooth speaker with a device that is part of that group, using the group will kick the Bluetooth speaker off. Only the Amazon products connect to each other and play simultaneously. Good luck!

entry.question: Can I use this like an alarm clock where I can tell it to come on and play a preset fm station to wake me up in the morning?
entry.answer: It is easy to do. Ask Alexa to wake you at a certain time and in my case I just gave her a time and she responded with is that morning or afternoon. I responded with AM and at the designated time I got a musical note arrangement. Kinda neat. However I have not asked for a particular song to play.

entry.question: How do I connect lights to the Echo?
entry.answer: You need to have one of the following: Alexa-compatible Smart bulb, Alexa-compatible Smart plug, or Alexa-compatible Smart switch.

entry.question: what is the major difference between amazon echo (2nd gen) and Echo Plus?
entry.answer: is there a cost to just listen to music

entry.question: If we install the landlines option will we "still have to have" a smartphone with cell service to setup calling with drop in to function properly?
entry.answer: Can Echo connect to Bose speaker? (as an Echo Dot can do)

entry.question: can you Bluetooth echo to your wifi?
entry.answer: You can but not with the group function, whole house needs to hard wired.

entry.question: Tell me about the connection to an external amplifier. What's required both ends?
entry.answer: You can connect via Bluetooth or with a cable by the 3.5mm stereo jack on the Echo. If you plan to leave it connected you might consider the less expensive Dot which is identical to the Echo except for size. So, on the Echo/Dot side, Bluetooth or 3.5mm plug. On the amp/receiver/external speaker side, whatever connection is compatible. Most have an "aux in" which is usually 3.5mm also. Sometimes RCA plugs (yellow and white.)

entry.question: What is the warranty on the echo 2nd generation? I ordered from Amazon.
entry.answer: The Echo comes with a 1-year limited warranty and service included. Optional 1-year, 2-year, and 3-year extended warranty available for U.S. Customers sold separately.

entry.question: If I have two Echos in same room for added sound will they both respond and play music in sync ?
entry.answer: No. All Echo devices use what Amazon calls "Echo Spatial Perception" which is a fancy way to say that if more than one Echo device hears your request, they can work out which device is the closest to you and only that one will respond.

entry.question: Can wife and me use Alexa?
entry.answer: Yes, more than one person can use Alexa, there is even a voice recognition capability.

entry.question: Is the power cord still black on the new color Echo 2's?
entry.answer: yes, I have 2 of them and they both are black.

entry.question: I run robust wi-fi security. The passcode is quite lengthy. Could this be an issue? Can't use nest w/o shortening the code.
entry.answer: I have a lengthy passcode as well and it worked just fine.

entry.question: Will echo dot and echo work separately on same wi-fi? eg play different radio stations at the same time?
entry.answer: Yes it will. Except that it will play Prime music on only one at a time. Pandora and iHeartRadio will play on multiple Echo devices.

entry.question: Does it speak Portuguese?
entry.answer: Not yet, no. Current language options are English, German and Japanese.

entry.question: Why does it say the alexa network is unsecured
entry.answer: Not sure. Maybe your wifi connection is not password protected? Be sure you have a password. Other than that, do not know what it means.

entry.question: Can I unplug it and still listen to music?
entry.answer: If you want to use without having to worry about having a plug handy, check out the Tap. You charge it on a base and can then take it anywhere without worrying about a plug. I use mine all over the house and yard. It now has voice control so you do not have to push the button to communicate.

entry.question: I just opened the box for an echo ii, and there is no power cord. is it supposed to have one included?
entry.answer: Yes, it is normally in a small potion of the black interior "package/box". I have purchased two Echos and one Echo Dot and all three came with a power cord.

entry.question: I do not own a smart phone but have a computer Windows 10. Can I use the echo with this?
entry.answer: You can do the basic setup with a browser: http://alexa.amazon.com The smartphone app is necessary to enable Alexa Calling features.

entry.question: Is the wood better more durable than the cloth one?
entry.answer: I like the the cloth version but depends on the taste I guess To me it hides better the dirt and the material looks durable.

entry.question: So will this stand on its own or do I need Alexa for it to work?
entry.answer: You need Alexa, which is free.

entry.question: How to check battery level?
entry.answer: there are add on rechargeable bases.

entry.question: What's the price? How much is it?
entry.answer: It's $99.99. Buy 2 and save $30. Add 2 Echo (2nd Generation) devices to your cart and automatically receive $30 off. Or 5 monthly payments of $20.00.

entry.question: What are the color options?
entry.answer: We have Charcoal Fabric, Heather Gray Fabric, Oak Finish, Sandstone Fabric, Walnut Finish.

entry.question: What are the color options?
entry.answer: We have Charcoal Fabric, Heather Gray Fabric, Oak Finish, Sandstone Fabric, Walnut Finish.

entry.question: How to play music?
entry.answer: The 2nd generation Echo has a 2.5” downward-firing woofer and 0.6” tweeter powered by Dolby to deliver crisp vocals and dynamic bass throughout the room. You can play music from Amazon Music, Spotify, Pandora, iHeartRadio, TuneIn, and more. With Amazon Music, you can search by lyrics, time-period, or let Alexa pick the music for you. Set a music alarm to wake up to your favorite song or playlist. You can also listen to audiobooks from Audible, podcasts, radio stations, news briefs, and more.

entry.question: If I have more than one Echo, how to play music in different rooms?
entry.answer: Want to play music on an Echo in another room? Now with multi-room music, you can tell Alexa to play across your compatible Echo devices. Tell Alexa to play jazz in the kitchen, top pop in the family room, or play the same song throughout your whole home.

entry.question: How to control home devices like light or TV?
entry.answer:
Use Echo to switch on the lamp before getting out of bed, turn on the coffee maker on your way to the kitchen, or dim the lights from the couch to watch a movie—all without lifting a finger. Ask Alexa to turn on the TV, turn up the volume, change the channel, or play your favorite movie. Echo can control your Amazon Fire TV and select devices from Sony, Dish, and Logitech.
Control multiple devices at scheduled times or with a single voice command, like locking the doors and turning off the lights when you go to bed. Echo works with lights, locks, switches, thermostats, and more from WeMo, Philips Hue, SmartThings, Insteon, Nest, ecobee, and Wink.

entry.question: How to talk or message to people with Echo?
entry.answer:
With Echo, you can talk to almost anyone hands-free—no tapping or searching required. Use the Drop In feature when you want to connect instantly with compatible Echo devices in your home. For example, you can ask someone for help with a chore, or remind the kids to go to sleep—without having to raise your voice. With Alexa Announcements you can also use Echo to broadcast a quick, one-way message to all other Echo devices in your home.
Making calls with Alexa is easy. Your contacts will see your number when they receive the call so they know who is calling. Set up your voice profile and teach Alexa to recognize your voice. When you say, “Alexa, call Mom”, Alexa will call your mom, even if you have multiple users in your home. Additionally, you can send messages via voice or text to anyone with a supported Echo device or the Alexa App.

entry.question: How can it recognize my voice? How to use it?
entry.answer:
Tucked under the light ring is an array of seven microphones that use beamforming technology and enhanced noise cancellation. The 2nd generation Echo has improved wake-word performance to hear you ask a question from any direction—even in noisy environments or while playing music at loud volumes.
When you want to use Echo, simply say the wake word, “Alexa,” and Echo lights up and connects to the cloud, where the Alexa Voice Service recognizes and responds to your request instantly. Learn more about voice recognition on Echo.

entry.question: What else can it do?
entry.answer:
Echo uses tens of thousands of skills and counting. Skills add even more capabilities like ordering a pizza from Domino's, requesting a ride from Uber, tracking your fitness with Fitbit, controlling your TV with Dish, and more. To enable new skills, just ask Alexa.
New skills are being added all the time. You can also see ratings and reviews to learn what other customers are saying about the thousands of skills available in the Alexa App.

entry.question: What's the difference between versions of Echo? Compare Echo devices.
entry.answer: Besides price, for Echo Dot, Echo, Echo plus, the main difference is the speaker, and Echo plus has a built-in hub for simple setup of compatible smart home devices. Echo Spot and Echo Show has screen, difference is the size of screen.

entry.question: What's the size and weight?
entry.answer: Device size (actual size and weight may vary): 1.3" x 3.3" x 3.3", 5.7 oz. (32 mm x 84 mm x 84 mm, 163 grams)

entry.question: What's the Wi-Fi hardware and connectivity?
entry.answer: Dual-band Wi-Fi supports 802.11 a/b/g/n (2.4 and 5 GHz) networks. Does not support connecting to ad-hoc (or peer-to-peer) Wi-Fi networks.

entry.question: What's the Bluetooth hardware and connectivity?
entry.answer: Advanced Audio Distribution Profile (A2DP) support for audio streaming from your mobile device to Echo or from Echo to your Bluetooth speaker. Audio/Video Remote Control Profile (AVRCP) for voice control of connected mobile devices. Hands-free voice control is not supported for Mac OS X devices. Bluetooth speakers requiring PIN codes are not supported.

entry.question: What's the audio specification?
entry.answer: 2.5” (63.5 mm) woofer and 0.6” (16 mm) tweeter.

entry.question: How to find the Alexa App?
entry.answer: The Alexa App is compatible with Fire OS, Android, and iOS devices. You can find it on App Store or Google Play store.

entry.question: How is the sound quality?
entry.answer: This latest model is better sound quality than old versions.
